text: I'm making a quick pickle for a grilled
fish sandwich like upon me that's a
vietnamese sandwich and pickled
vegetables are a foundation of lots of
vietnamese cuisine so use a mandolin or
a sharp knife too thinly slice a
cucumber and for radishes now you may be
thinking that this sounds like rabbit
food so far but we are going to get to
the other stuff soon and for these
carrots how beautiful are these use a
peeler it's easier than a knife
certainly and you want thin ribbons so
that they're not too hard leave the top
on and it acts as a handle and our
pickling liquid very simple salt about a
half a teaspoon two teaspoons of good ol
granulated sugar to a balance the
acidity and rice wine vinegar has a
really nice gentle flavor I want about a
quarter cup here that looks good that
goes right over the vegetables and give
this a good toss you can do this ahead
and chill it in the fridge until you're
ready to use it all right I think we're
ready for fish red snapper is a firm
textured saltwater fish has a nice mild
flavor and drizzle with a little oil and
generously season with salt and pepper
these things always take more seasoning
than you think and don't forget about
the other side I have the grill already
preheating that's important because if
you try to put this down onto a cold
grill it's going to stick so really be
sure that grill is smoking hot and again
more salt and pepper ok this is ready
for the fire ok I'm going to use the
hand trick that feels nice and hot so I
know it's ready and very important here
be sure to oil the grades just before
you put the fish down don't boil them
ahead of time because the greats can
actually become tacky and sticky if the
oil sit you're gonna get some smoke here
but that's ok that's a good sign that
it's nice and hot and on goes the fish
as tempting as it may be do not touch
the fish let it get a nice sear on the
grill and then it will release itself
and be easy to flip I also have for
hamburger buns Portuguese rolls are
great too these will take about three
minutes per side these are looking close
you
see that the edges have turned okay
that's the sign that the fish is about
ready to flip and I'm just going to
start in the corner yep that's coming
right off the grill and you have to just
be brave and go for it don't hesitate or
you'll run into trouble just like that
and two to three minutes more on the
second side and we're ready to eat as
these finish up i'm going to start
grilling these buns here these happen in
a flash you can see that the flesh is
pulling away and becoming flaky here
that's a good sign that it's nearly done
so if you just gently press on the fish
you can check for doneness there and
it's giving me resistance so I know that
the center is not quite cooked through
yet but it's close okay looks like the
buns and the fish are finishing up at
the same time here yep that one's ready
to go very gently lift off the oat well
the good news is we're splitting this in
half anyway to the sandwich so no one
will be the wiser okay and the second
fillet mm-hmm this is going to be
delicious combine a little sriracha into
a third of a cup of mayo about a
teaspoon and a half more if you like it
spicy or less if you don't and this also
takes on a beautiful pink hue as it
comes together and the buns we grilled
earlier a generous portion of mayo
sriracha mayo that is on either side Wow
YUM
yum and our fish I'm going to just let
this flake off and about half one fillet
will make two sandwiches wow this is
gorgeous and those pickles we made
earlier you can see that the veggies
have started to soften so I'm going to
just put some of these right on top of
the fish that's so pretty and cilantro
now this is a fish sandwich autumn grill
